title: krishnaverma
author: krishnaverma
content: I recently found this cool websitehttps://buybitcoinworldwide.com/bitcoin-is-dead/It has listed 20 occasions when bitcoin was declared dead by leading publications in the past and every time bitcoin came back stronger. So , next time if some popular news website tells you that bitcoin is dead, do not trust it blindly. Bitcoin still has lot of scope for growth and adoption.

Not entirely correct, in 2018, 2020, 2021 and 2022 there were short dump, that's mean not every Bitcoin declared is dead will make Bitcoin price came back stronger. Many people already trust in Bitcoin, if you look the occasions after 2019, it's full of economist, investors, bankers etc that are the real Bitcoin's haters because they scared if Bitcoin perform better than the bank and the other commodity.It's like judges vs lawyer since each of them will argue they're correct in their opinion.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: You need to understand that they write more articles when it’s something bearish than bullish because people tend to read the bearish articles more.It’s funny because I actually remember reading about bitcoin when it was like $30 or so and crashed down to $1 and there was an article calling bitcoin a scam. And I actually believed it and it wasn’t Until a few years later when I discovered it again and found it fascinating.

Besides, I have read many articles saying that Bitcoin is dead, but all of them are not true. And obviously, they are just Bitcoin haters.

comments.author: taufik123
comments.body: LOL is a kind of FUD that is deliberately spread to influence the market price, so that those behind the FUD news get bitcoin at a low price.This has become a fairly common practice and is often found anywhere. This means that Bitcoin will die, but in reality, Bitcoin continues to strengthen and become the most popular decentralized digital asset. It has even been adopted in several countries as a legal tender. News about the death of Bitcoin will increase, and even people who are skeptical about Bitcoin will give mixed responses. Bitcoin will never die and even continue to grow. Expecting the death of Bitcoin will only be a waste of time.

comments.author: GreatArkansas
comments.body: I am waiting for the day that it will be a slap for those people who are telling me Bitcoin is dead.Because there are already a lot of people who experienced a lot of bear market and bull market but they are still here, it means, Bitcoin will never die.

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: When the price of Bitcoin reaches $1 million, they will continue to say that Bitcoin is dead. In the meantime, the best we can do is laugh at that FUD, especially in dips and bear makets and take advantage of those moments to keep accumulating, to buy cheap. There is one thing that is clear and that is that whoever did not get carried away by that FUD, today is better off economically than if he did not have Bitcoin, and will continue to be so in the future.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Only when you think about how stupid it is to say something like "Bitcoin is dead", we realize how stupid those who persistently say it really are. Bitcoin is not a living being that someone can take its life, and not even technically kill it in the sense that it will disappear at some point - but that only shows how some people do not understand what real decentralization is.The only difference between those who publish such news is that some are really stupid to understand, and the others understand very well but are paid to write nonsense.

comments.author: xSkylarx
comments.body: This is really a website that will slap a person who is going to say Bitcoin is dead, as you can see how much Bitcoin went through but still survived. I know that there are really people that think this, but I don't understand why they always think that Bitcoin will die, which is their preference. But looking at the OP infographic, if you understand it, then for sure you'll be able to understand why people still want to invest in bitcoin no matter what.

comments.author: famososMuertos
comments.body: Hi OP,It is not about what you read, what they tell you, what happens in certain moments of volatility, it is about yourself, as individuals we define what bitcoin essentially really is. If you trust bitcoin and keep it above any situation, its existence depends on ourselves.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: That's a good piece of information you have shared here, and all the information is integrated in the graph too. Thanks for such useful information. It has everything necessary to silence the haters. hehe. I will definitely share these with those who speak wrongly about BTC and always criticise it; instead, they should criticise the methods one follows to make money.Like many times, people come up with hugely greedy and risky ideas to book some more profits, and they stick themselves in huge problems besides financial ones, and at the end they talk bad about BTC.On the positive side, this graph could be used to motivate ourselves and others who just got hit or lost assets due to the manipulation in the market. As we all know, these dips in BTC are temporary. But still, losers lose, and those who lose have to bear the consequences, but those few words do all the work and keep them motivated and encouraged, so they just do not lose hope.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: Why concern yourself with haters? Despite presenting numerous reasons to support Bitcoin, they'll continue to harbor negativity. I suspect some haters might secretly engage with Bitcoin for personal gain, but that's just my opinion. Regardless, Bitcoin thrives for us even if detractors wish otherwise. Haters may criticize, but they can't alter reality. Instead of reading their content, concentrate on our objectives and accomplishments.
